_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:18:09 using v2.0
title: How have breaches of the four hour target changed?
analysis_commentary: Overall, the proportion of people experiencing long waits (over four hours), for the total time spent in A&E , rose between November 2010 and January 2014. The 'total time' is how long the patient spent in A&E from arrival to when the patient leaves the department - to be admitted, transferred or discharged. The period between January and April 2013 saw particularly high levels of patients waiting over four hours - was 5.07% of all emergency admissions, compared with an overall average of 2.22% for the preceding 26 months. The proportion waiting over four hours then dropped sharply after April 2013 (from May to January 2013), with an average of 2.72% of emergency admissions waiting over four hours for a bed.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
